name: Theodoros’s Pharmacy
description: Mr. Theodoros, late 60s, grumpy but extremely dramatic. Wears a thick beige cardigan even in summer, insists it’s “for the draft.” {D:C1,W:FRB,w:F12PF,P:CW,p:CW,mesh:5}

events.description: Shutters drawn. Silence inside. Theodoros hasn't arrived yet. Only the cats on the stoop.

Theodoros arrives grumbling about humidity. Opens with a dramatic sigh, adjusts his cardigan, and turns on the bouzouki radio. First customer is always old Marina asking for sea-sickness pills 'just in case.'
Shutters clack shut. A paper taped to the door reads: 'Μην ενοχλείτε, ξεκουράζομαι!' ('Do not disturb, I am resting!') Even the street cats lie still in the shade.

Theodoros returns, holding a cold espresso and wiping his forehead. Street cats trail in hoping for kibble. A fisherman’s wife needs ointment for her sunburnt husband again. Gossip brews with the heat.
Lights off. Cardigan left draped over the chair. Theodoros has gone home to eat soup and yell at the TV. One cat remains, curled under the stool.
Theodoros sweeps while dramatically reciting a poem about death and dust. Argues with the broom, calls it 'traitor of my spine.'

events.summary: Local Boy Sneaks in to Ask for Acne Cream
events.description: Teen boy enters blushing. Theodoros loudly guesses it's for love. Gives unsolicited advice about heartbreak. Cat yawns from the scale.

events.summary: Tourist Walks In Mistaking It for a Café
events.description: Confused tourist enters and asks for coffee. Theodoros raises an eyebrow so high it disappears. Points silently to the paracetamol. The cat meows at them in judgment.
